PARAGRAPH.STRING: is a major river in Canada, approximately 550 km (340 mi) long, flowing roughly eastward across Saskatchewan and Manitoba to drain into Lake Winnipeg. Through
tributaries the North Saskatchewan and South Saskatchewan,
watershed encompasses much of the prairie regions of central Canada, stretching westward to the Rocky Mountains in Alberta and into northern Montana in the United States.
reaches approximates 1,939 km (1204 and a half miles) to
furthest headwaters on the Bow River, a tributary of the South Saskatchewan in Alberta.
